Key Match Events: Deniz Undav scored a brace to secure Germany's 2-1 victory over Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Edin Dzeko pulled one back for Bosnia and Herzegovina, setting up a nervy finish.
Undav's potential hat-trick was denied by VAR for offside.
Ermedin Demirovic hit the bar for Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Florian Wirtz assisted Undav's first goal with a well-timed pass.
Maximilian Mittelstadt provided the assist for Undav's second goal.
Serge Gnabry's goal was also ruled out for offside.
Benjamin Tahirovic assisted Dzeko's goal with a corner kick.
Pre-Game Insights: Germany were favorites to win despite their previous poor away record in the Nations League.
Germany had won just four of their previous 13 matches outside of Germany.
Post-Match Reflections: Julian Nagelsmann's side strengthened their position at the top of Group A3.
Germany maintained their unbeaten start to the Nations League season.
Deniz Undav built on his momentum from scoring against the Netherlands in the previous match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany now have a two-point cushion at the top of Group A3.
Germany had to ensure their concentration levels did not wane after Dzeko’s header.
